meanings.sent1: The doctor had to reinject the medicine to ensure it was effective.
meanings.sent2: After the power outage, the technician had to reinject the code into the system.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally pulled out the needle too soon, so I had to reinject the vaccine.
meanings.sent4: She had to reinject enthusiasm into her presentation after the technical difficulties.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to reinject oil into the engine to keep it running smoothly.

meanings.definition: To introduce again into a system or process.
meanings.sent1: The IT specialist had to reinject the updated software into the network.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to reinject the missing ingredient back into the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to reinject fun into the lesson to keep the students engaged.
meanings.sent4: The artist had to reinject creativity into the project to make it more appealing.
meanings.sent5: The coach had to reinject motivation into the team before the big game.
